p: The Lineweaver-Burk plots of the other extracts showed a mixed type of inhibition characteristics, since increasing the concentration of extracts resulted in a family of straight lines with different slope and y-intercepts, which intersected in the second quadrant, example in Figure 1(b). This kinetic analysis indicates that these extracts can bind not only with the free enzyme but also with the enzyme-substrate complex. The equilibrium constants for binding with the free enzyme (K I) and with the enzyme-substrate complex ( K IS ) were obtained from the slope ( K m / V max) or the 1/ V max values ( y-intercepts) versus inhibitor concentration, respectively ( Table 2).
